attributes.action: UAE to release on humanitarian grounds tortured British student Ahmad Zeidan
attributes.background: Ahmad Zeidan, a British student in UAE arrested and sentenced to nine years after a tiny speck of prohibited substance was allegedly found in a car he was riding in. He was hooded, beaten, placed in solitary and forced to sign a "confession" in Arabic. He was denied a Supreme Court appeal hearing.

rejection.details: This isn't something that the UK Government or Parliament could do. You could start a petition calling on the UK Government to urge the UAE to take this action.
